Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 08/26/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12311 Foster parent/agency agreement
(3) An agency shall document review of the foster
parent/agency agreement with the foster family at least
annually and, when needed, develop a new agreement.
One of three foster home files reviewed did not have a current parent/agency
agreement.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED:
08/28/23 Interim, CAP approved, 10/26/23
08/18/22 Renewal, CAP approved 11/14/22.
CPA Rule 400.12312 Foster parent training
(2) The foster parent training plan shall provide for all of
the following:
(b) Not less than 6 hours of training annually for
each licensee after the time periods specified in
subdivisions (a) of this subrule.

One of three foster home files reviewed did not have 6 training hours for one of the
foster parents.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED:
08/28/23 Interim, CAP approved, 10/26/23
CPA Rule 400.12422 Foster care case record.
(3) The record must contain all the following information:
(g) A photograph taken at least annually.
One of three foster care files reviewed did not contain a current photograph of the
child.
CPA Rule 400.12418 Development of service plans
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for
each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the
home.
One of three foster care files reviewed contained a late ISP report.
CPA Rule 400.12418 D evelopment of service plans
2) An agency shall complete written service plans for
each child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal
and at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of three foster care files reviewed contained a late USP report.
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
(2) The agreement must be signed and dated by the
youth and the social service worker. The agreement

must be reviewed with the youth at least once every 90
calendar days and a copy provided to the youth
One of one files reviewed, did not document updated independent living
agreements.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
Initial Case Plan (ISP) - within 30 calendar days before
the case plan due date. Note: This FTM may be
combined with the CPS Case Opening (ISP) FTM.
Updated Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date. Permanent Ward Service
Plan (PWSP) - within 30 calendar days before the case
plan due date.
Three of three files reviewed, lacked one or more FTM’s. One file also contained an
FTM that was held more than thirty days from the service plan due date.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED:
08/28/23 Interim, CAP approved, 10/26/23
08/18/22 Renewal, CAP approved 11/14/22.
FOM 801-03 Medical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport must
be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the
child's current and complete health information.
One of three foster care files reviewed lacked a second quarter 2024 updated
medical passport.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED:
08/28/23 Interim, CAP approved, 10/26/23
08/18/22 Renewal, CAP approved 11/14/22.

FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans
Once completed and approved, the caseworker must
obtain signatures from the following individuals, as
applicable:
Caseworker. • Supervisor. • Second line supervisor, when
siblings in care are placed apart. • Parents who are a
member of a participating household. • Youth ages 14 and
older. • Foster parents, relative caregivers, and unrelated
court ordered caregivers.
Three of three foster care files reviewed contained one or more treatment plans that
lacked signatures, or the signatures were late.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED:
08/28/23 Interim, CAP approved, 10/26/23
C08/18/22 Renewal, CAP approved 11/14/22.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that
incident reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those incidents
named under the rule are to be submitted.
• DCWL review of Corrective Action Plans (CAP). The agency was
informed that starting January 1, 2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's will
be reviewed with the agency at three months and six months. The assigned
Consultant for the agency will work with the agency in conducting CAP
reviews. This process for special investigation CAP reviews was implemented
previously.
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was informed
that all the training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required yearly for
foster care workers carrying a caseload as well as for supervisors who may
be carrying a caseload.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency submitted an approved corrective action plan on 10/26/23 in response
to violations established during the Interim Inspection completed on 08/28/23. The
current Renewal Inspection established repeat violations of the following rules and
policy: R 400.12311 Foster Parent/Agency agreement, R 400.12312 Foster Parent
Training, FOM 722-08D Treatment Plans, FOM 722-06B Family Team Meetings,
and FOM 801-03 Medical Passport.
The agency submitted an approved CAP on 07/08/24 in response to four
violations established during special investigation 2024SIC0001482. The
violations were R 400.12324 (1), (2) (a), (8), and R 400.12325-2.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators assessment was reviewed. The assessment reviewed
citations established during the 2023 Interim Inspection and agency efforts to
comply with the corrective action plan. The assessment discussed unplanned
removals as well as the monitoring of Info View reports monitored by the agency
supervisor and the DHHS Monitor.
Financial Overview
The agency annual budget was submitted and reviewed as well as an annual
certified public accountant audit. There were no concerns noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported enjoying working at the agency and they feel supported by their
supervisor and the agency administration. Staff also reported they feel they are
part of a solid supportive team.

Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern facility in downtown Houghton, Michigan. The
agency has sufficient office space. CHRI documents were observed to be stored
securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Safety Alert #1: A safety alert was generated on 5-29-24 as several concerns in a
foster home were identified including missing smoke detectors, a missing carbon
monoxide detector, weapons were not stored properly, and no alarms on doors
leading to a pool.
Resolution: DCWL initiated special investigation #2024SIC0001482 and four
citations were established, and a CAP was required. The foster home received
operable smoke detectors, carbon monoxide detectors, a gun safe, door alarms and
pool rescue equipment.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
